Having gone through this quite long process and being where you are now,
I guess, would there be anything that you would share with your younger self,
like, or is there any advice that you could give to some fit young savage,
man or woman who's found Giu-Jitsu like you did, maybe had a bit of early success,
feeling like, yeah, this is sick.
I want this.
What would you say to them?
What are three things that you could give to them that they could then take and apply?
I, off the top of the dome piece, I think the first one would be to just try to cultivate
a little bit more awareness about around your training.
Like, just try to think a little bit more.
Those first few years for me, I was just going hard.
You know, ask anyone that trained me why I'm doing it.
Joe is just the fucking spaz.
You know, it's just like a tornado tearing through the gym.
And it's like, yeah, like that, you know, and it's still in me.
And I think that's an important thing to have.
But, you know, I think if I had it just worked to a little bit more awareness,
a bit more, I came back off on the strength a little bit because that's always been the feedback for me.
Little bit less strength, take it a little bit slower.
And when you do that, I see your Giu-Jitsu.
You know, that would be the first thing.
And it doesn't mean you have to squash that beginner physicality at all.
It's just like, try not to rely on it 100% of the time.
Second part for me, I've been very fortunate.
I've always been quite mobile.
And I look back and I think I was kind of blessed in a way because I'd never
suffered from joint restrictions.
So I had mobile hips.
I had, you know, pretty good spine, all that stuff from the beginning.
So once I lay it in the strength training, and then, you know, a little bit of mobility work,
I was always quite, you know.
Safe then.
Yeah, but looking at every person, every other person, it's after you,
that I've trained with over the years that I've met.
It's like, man, if you just stretched a little bit more,
just took a little bit more, like put in, you know, 30 minutes a week.
And you can sprinkle that across the week however you like.
Just stretch a little bit, try to open up your hips.
Like, that is so fucking important.
And then the third, you know what?
This is actually huge.
